intro: Cynoglossum calycinum, commonly known as the blue bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to southern Europe and western Asia. It features striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer, typically from July to September. The plant has a basal rosette of lance-shaped, hairy leaves and grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long-lasting flowers and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
